movie.title: Can You Ever Forgive Me?
movie.description_intro: Lee Israel (Melissa McCarthy) made her living in the 1970s and '80s profiling the likes of Katharine Hepburn, Tallulah Bankhead, Estee Lauder and journalist Dorothy Kilgallen. When Lee is no longer able to get published because she has fallen out of step with current tastes, she turns her art form to deception, abetted by her loyal friend Jack (Richard E. Grant). An adaptation of the memoir "Can You Ever Forgive Me?" relays the true story of the best-selling celebrity biographer (and friend to cats).
movie.description_full: Lee Israel (Melissa McCarthy) made her living in the 1970s and '80s profiling the likes of Katharine Hepburn, Tallulah Bankhead, Estee Lauder and journalist Dorothy Kilgallen. When Lee is no longer able to get published because she has fallen out of step with current tastes, she turns her art form to deception, abetted by her loyal friend Jack (Richard E. Grant). An adaptation of the memoir "Can You Ever Forgive Me?" relays the true story of the best-selling celebrity biographer (and friend to cats).

movies.title: The Boys & Girls Guide to Getting Down
movies.title_english: The Boys & Girls Guide to Getting Down
movies.title_long: The Boys & Girls Guide to Getting Down (2006)
movies.summary: Tongue-in-cheek look at 20-something singles clubbing and partying in L.A.; it's organized into 15 chapters from overview and preparation to partying and the morning after. Voice-over narration, charts and graphs, and visits to a research laboratory punctuate the story of a single night when groups of friends go out, drink alcohol, take drugs, dance and talk, and look for someone to go home with. Dangers, minor and major, await those who don't plan well or behave foolishly, and the rewards, even for those who plan well, are few. But the species' survival may depend on these rituals.

movies.title: Le chant du Styrène
movies.summary: Poetic and aesthetic visit of a large polystyrene factory.
movies.description_full: Poetic and aesthetic visit of a large polystyrene factory.
movies.synopsis: Poetic and aesthetic visit of a large polystyrene factory.

movies.title: I Start Counting
movies.summary: A 14-year-old girl coming to terms with her sexuality, discovers that her adored older foster brother may be guilty of a series of bizarre sex crimes.
movies.description_full: A 14-year-old girl coming to terms with her sexuality, discovers that her adored older foster brother may be guilty of a series of bizarre sex crimes.
movies.synopsis: A 14-year-old girl coming to terms with her sexuality, discovers that her adored older foster brother may be guilty of a series of bizarre sex crimes.

movies.title: Cahill U.S. Marshal
movies.summary: J.D. Cahill is the toughest U.S. Marshal they've got, just the sound of his name makes bad guys stop in their tracks, so when his two young boys want to get his attention they decide to rob a bank. They end up getting more than they bargained for.
